name: Measure area by counting full squares 1

skills.name: Find the area of rectilinear shapes by counting squares

explanations.A: This square has side length 3 but its area is 9 square units. Look for the diagram made with 3 squares as this will have an area of 3 square units...
explanations.B: The area of this diagram is 2 square units, we are looking for the diagram with an area of 3 square units...
explanations.C: If each square has an area of one square unit, we need the diagram which has 3 squares as this will have an area of 3 square units. This is diagram C!
explanations.D: The area of this diagram is 4 square units, we are looking for the diagram with an area of 3 square units...

explanations.A: The area of this diagram is 2 square units, we are looking for the diagram with an area of 3 square units...
explanations.B: If each small square has an area of one square unit, we need the diagram which has 4 small squares as this will have an area of 4 square units. This is diagram B!
explanations.C: The area of this diagram is 3 square units, we are looking for the diagram with an area of 4 square units...
explanations.D: This square has side length 4 but its area is 16 square units. Look for the diagram made with 4 squares as this will have an area of 4 square units...

explanations.A: This does have an area of 4 square units but do any of the other images too?
explanations.B: This square has side length 4 but its area is 16 square units. Look for the diagram made with 4 squares as this will have an area of 4 square units...
explanations.C: This does have an area of 4 square units but do any of the other images too?
explanations.D: Both diagrams A and C are made from 4 squares so have areas of 4 square units.

explanations.A: This square has side length 6 but its area is 36 square units. Look for the diagram made with 6 squares as this will have an area of 6 square units...
explanations.B: This does have an area of 6 square units but do any of the other images too?
explanations.C: This does have an area of 6 square units but do any of the other images too?
explanations.D: Both diagrams B and C are made from 6 squares so have areas of 4 square units.

explanations.A: The area of this diagram is 5 square units, we are looking for the diagram with an area of 6 square units...
explanations.B: This shape has a perimeter of 6 but we are looking for the shape with an area of 6 square units. Look for the shape made using 6 squares...
explanations.C: If each square has an area of one square unit, we need the diagram which has 6 squares as this will have an area of 6 square units. This is diagram C!
explanations.D: Diagram A only has an area of 5 square units. We are looking for the shape with an area of 6 square units...

explanations.A: The area of this diagram is 4 square units, we are looking for the diagram with an area of 8 square units...
explanations.B: This shape has a perimeter of 8 but we are looking for the shape with an area of 8 square units. Look for the shape made using 8 squares...
explanations.C: If each square has an area of one square unit, we need the diagram which has 8 squares as this will have an area of 8 square units. This is diagram C!
explanations.D: Not quite, we are looking for the diagram that has 8 small squares in to give an area of 8 square units...

explanations.A: The area of this diagram is 8 square units, we are looking for the diagram with an area of 9 square units...
explanations.B: If each square has an area of one square unit, we need the diagram which has 9 squares as this will have an area of 9 square units. This is diagram B!
explanations.C: The area of this diagram is 8 square units, we are looking for the diagram with an area of 9 square units...
explanations.D: Diagram C only has an area of 8 square units. We are looking for the shape with an area of 9 square units...

explanations.A: We need the diagram which has 15 squares as this will have an area of 15 square units. This is diagram A, as it is almost a 4x4 square (area 16 square units) but with one piece taken out (16 - 1 = 15 square units).
explanations.B: The area of this diagram is 14 square units, we are looking for the diagram with an area of 15 square units...
explanations.C: The area of this diagram is 17 square units, we are looking for the diagram with an area of 15 square units...
explanations.D: A is a 4x4 square with one piece taken out, and C is a 4x4 square with an extra piece added on, so they can't have the same area. Does one of them have an area of 15 square units?

explanations.A: This does have an area of 12 square units but do any of the other shapes too?
explanations.B: This does have an area of 12 square units but do any of the other shapes too?
explanations.C: The area of this shape is 5 square units, we are looking for the shape with an area of 12 square units...
explanations.D: Both shapes A and B are made from 12 squares so have areas of 12 square units.

explanations.A: The area of this shape is 12 square units, we are looking for the shape with an area of 16 square units...
explanations.B: This does have an area of 16 square units but do any of the other shapes too?
explanations.C: This does have an area of 16 square units but do any of the other shapes too?
explanations.D: Both shapes B and C are made from 16 squares so have areas of 16 square units.
